name: The Thirteen Books of the Elements: 1
description: This is the definitive edition of one of the very greatest classics of all time — the full Euclid, not an abridgement. Using the text established by Heiberg, Sir Thomas Heath encompasses almost 2,500 years of mathematical and historical study upon Euclid.
subject: Math
author: Euclid

name: The Thirteen Books of the Elements: 2
description: This is the definitive edition of one of the very greatest classics of all time — the full Euclid, not an abridgement. Using the text established by Heiberg, Sir Thomas Heath encompasses almost 2,500 years of mathematical and historical study upon Euclid.
subject: Math
author: Euclid

name: The Thirteen Books of the Elements: 3
description: This is the definitive edition of one of the very greatest classics of all time — the full Euclid, not an abridgement. Using the text established by Heiberg, Sir Thomas Heath encompasses almost 2,500 years of mathematical and historical study upon Euclid.
subject: Math
author: Euclid

name: Algoritmi, monaci e mercanti. Il calcolo nella vita quotidiana del Medioevo
description: Di algoritmi si parla molto oggi con riferimento ai computer, a Google, alla profilazione degli utenti dei social e all'avvento dell'intelligenza artificiale.
subject: History, Math
author: Giorgio Ausiello

name: The Manager's Path: A Guide for Tech Leaders Navigating Growth and Change
description: Managing people is difficult wherever you work. But in the tech industry, where management is also a technical discipline, the learning curve can be brutal, especially when there are few tools, texts, and frameworks to help you.
subject: Management, Tech
author: Camille Fournier

name: Progredire a scacchi. Con i più grandi giocatori della storia. 25 partite di culto
description: 25 partite che vi permetteranno di entrare nella mente dei più grandi campioni di tutti i tempi: scoprirete come ragionano, le domande che si pongono e soprattutto come rispondono agli attacchi!
subject: Chess
author: Kévin Bordi, Samy Robin

name: La prova matematica dell'esistenza di Dio
description: Gödel fornisce, in questo piccolo scritto, una dimostrazione logica dell'esistenza di Dio: impresa che oggi potrà anche sembrare anacronistica, ma che si situa nella scia di una tradizione millenaria
subject: Math, Logic, Philosophy
author: Kurt Gödel

name: Tutta la matematica. Per capire i concetti e imparare i fondamentali dagli insiemi alle equazioni differenziali
description: Tutte le spiegazioni necessarie per capire davvero Tutta la terminologia e i concetti chiave; Richiami storici che raccontano le tappe evolutive della disciplina.
subject: Math
author: Massimo Scorletti, Mario Italo Trioni

name: Tutta la fisica. Per capire i concetti e imparare i fondamentali dalla meccanica classica alla fisica quantistica
description: Un volume per studiare, ripassare e consultare velocemente dati e nozioni. Qui troverete tutti gli argomenti, i concetti chiave, le formule, i grafici e le tabelle.
subject: Physics
author: Massimo Scorletti

name: Simply Maths
description: Combining bold, elegant graphics with easy-to-understand text, Simply Maths is the perfect introduction to the subject for those who are short of time but hungry for knowledge.
subject: Math
author: DK

name: Simply Quantum Physics
description: Bold graphics and easy-to-understand explanations make it the most accessible guide to quantum physics on the market.
subject: Physics
author: DK

name: Rust for Rustaceans: Idiomatic Programming for Experienced Developers
description: For developers who've mastered the basics, this book is the next step on your way to professional-level programming in Rust.
subject: Programming, Rust
author: Steve Klabnik, Carol Nichols

name: Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software
description: This new expanded edition explores more deeply the bit-by-bit and gate-by-gate construction of the heart of every smart device, the central processing unit that combines the simplest of basic operations to perform the most complex of feats.
subject: Programming, Microelectronics
author: Charles Petzold

name: Real Analysis: A Long-Form Mathematics Textbook
description: This textbook is designed for students. Rather than the typical definition-theorem-proof-repeat style, this text includes much more commentary, motivation and explanation.
subject: Math
author: Jay Cummings

name: Proofs: A Long-Form Mathematics Textbook
description: This textbook is designed for students. Rather than the typical definition-theorem-proof-repeat style, this text includes much more commentary, motivation and explanation.
subject: Math
author: Jay Cummings

name: Science: The Definitive Visual Guide
description: From the humble beginnings of science, right through to today's information age - go on a journey through the history of science through its people, inventions, and discoveries.
subject: History, Science
author: DK, Adam Hart-Davis

name: Fisica ed Ingegneria del Reattore Nucleare: Manuale teorico ed operativo per impianti nucleari di potenza
description: Un libro unico per comprendere i principi e le modalità di funzionamento di un reattore e per diagnosticarne lo stato rilevando il suo comportamento nelle differenti condizioni operative.
subject: Physics
author: Prof GianCarlo Casarelli, Dr Stefano B Casarelli

name: The Principia the Authoritative Translation: Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy
description: n his monumental 1687 work, Philosophiae Naturalis Principia Mathematica, known familiarly as the Principia, Isaac Newton laid out in mathematical terms the principles of time, force, and motion that have guided the development of modern physical science.
subject: Math, Physics
author: Isaac Newton

name: Introduction to Space Dynamics
description: Although this classic introduction to space-flight engineering was first published not long after Sputnik was launched, the fundamental principles it elucidates are as varied today as then.
subject: Physics
author: William Tyrrell Thomson

name: Introduction to Quantum Mechanics: With Applications to Chemistry
description: When this classic text was first published in 1935, it fulfilled the goal of its authors 'to produce a textbook of practical quantum mechanics for the chemist, the experimental physicist, and the beginning student of theoretical physics.'
subject: Physics, Chemistry
author: Linus Pauling

name: Mathematics: Its Content, Methods and Meaning : Three Volumes Bound As One
description: This major survey of mathematics, featuring the work of 18 outstanding Russian mathematicians and including material on both elementary and advanced levels, encompasses 20 prime subject areas in mathematics in terms of their simple origins and their subsequent sophisticated developement.
subject: Math
author: A. D. Aleksandrov, A. N. Kolmogorov, M. A. Lavrent'ev

name: Quantum Theory
description: This superb text by David Bohm, formerly Princeton University and Emeritus Professor of Theoretical Physics at Birkbeck College, University of London, provides a formulation of the quantum theory in terms of qualitative and imaginative concepts that have evolved outside and beyond classical theory.
subject: Physics
author: David Bohm

name: Principles of Electrodynamics
description: Unlike most textbooks on electromagnetic theory, which treat electricity, magnetism, Coulomb's law and Faraday's law as almost independent subjects within the framework of the theory, this well-written text takes a relativistic point of view in which electric and magnetic fields are really different aspects of the same physical quantity.
subject: Physics
author: Melvin Schwartz

name: Calculus: An Intuitive and Physical Approach
description: Application-oriented introduction relates the subject as closely as possible to science. In-depth explorations of the derivative, the differentiation and integration of the powers of x, and theorems on differentiation and antidifferentiation, much more.
subject: Math, Physics
author: Morris Kline

name: Essential Calculus: With Applications
description: Calculus is an extremely powerful tool for solving a host of practical problems in fields as diverse as physics, biology, and economics, to mention just a few.
subject: Math, Science
author: Richard A. Silverman

name: Number Theory
description: Although mathematics majors are usually conversant with number theory by the time they have completed a course in abstract algebra, other undergraduates, especially those in education and the liberal arts, often need a more basic introduction to the topic.
subject: Math
author: George E. Andrews

name: Linear Algebra
description: In this volume in his exceptional series of translations of Russian mathematical texts, Richard Silverman has taken Shilov's course in linear algebra and has made it even more accessible and more useful for English language readers.
subject: Math
author: Georgi E. Shilov

name: Hacking: The Art of Exploitation
description: Hacking is the art of creative problem solving, whether that means finding an unconventional solution to a difficult problem or exploiting holes in sloppy programming. Many people call themselves hackers, but few have the strong technical foundation needed to really push the envelope.
subject: Programming, Hacking
author: Jon Erickson

name: Basic Electronics
description: Originally prepared for Naval training courses and so thoroughly revised in 1972 as to be an essentially new book, this introduction covers the important aspects of applied electronics and electronic communication.
subject: Electronics
author: U.S. Bureau of Naval Personnel

name: Mechanics
description: First published over 40 years ago, this work has achieved the status of a classic among introductory texts on mechanics. Den Hartog is known for his lively, discursive and often witty presentations of all the fundamental material of both statics and dynamics.
subject: Physics
author: J. P. Den Hartog

name: Basic Electricity
description: This expanded and revised U.S. Navy training course text provides thorough coverage of the basic theory of electricity and its applications. It is unquestionably the best book of its kind for either broad or more limited studies of electrical fundamentals.
subject: Physics
author: United States Navy

name: Basic Machines and How They Work
description: This revised edition of an extremely clear Navy training manual leaves nothing to be desired in its presentation. Thorough in its coverage of basic theory, from the lever and inclined plane to internal combustion engines and power trains, it requires nothing more than an understanding of the most elementary mathematics.
subject: Engineering
author: United States Bureau of Naval Personnel

name: Javascript: The Definitive Guide: Master the World's Most-used Programming Language
description: JavaScript is the programming language of the web and is used by more software developers today than any other programming language. For nearly 25 years this best seller has been the go-to guide for JavaScript programmers.
subject: Programming, JavaScript
author: David Flanagan

name: Programming TypeScript: Making Your JavaScript Applications Scale
description: Any programmer working with a dynamically typed language will tell you how hard it is to scale to more lines of code and more engineers. That's why Facebook, Google, and Microsoft invented gradual static type layers for their dynamically typed JavaScript and Python code.
subject: Programming, TypeScript
author: Boris Cherny

name: Il piacere di scoprire
description: Il libro raccoglie saggi di diverso argomento: dalla sociologia della scienza alla struttura dei calcolatori, dalla pedagogia al rapporto tra scienze e religione.
subject: Narrative, Physics
author: Richard P. Feynman

name: WebAssembly: The Definitive Guide: Safe, Fast, and Portable Code
description: WebAssembly: The Definitive Guide is a thorough and accessible introduction to one of the most transformative technologies hitting our industry. What started as a way to use languages other than JavaScript in the browser has evolved into a comprehensive path toward portability, performance, increased security, and greater code reuse across an impressive collection of deployment targets.
subject: Programming, C, JavaScript
author: Brian Sletten

name: Il lampo dell'elettrone. Le scoperte e la storia di un corpuscolo che ha cambiato la nostra vita
description: Per centinaia di anni la certezza è stata che l'atomo, indivisibile, rappresentasse il frammento elementare costitutivo della materia. Poi, il 30 aprile 1897, grazie a un semplice ma potente esperimento un ingegnoso scienziato inglese affermò che esisteva un corpuscolo, 1.700 volte più piccolo dell'atomo di idrogeno, responsabile della propagazione dei segnali elettrici.
subject: History, Physics, Microelectronics
author: Vittorio Pellegrini

name: Silicio. Dall'invenzione del microprocessore alla nuova scienza della consapevolezza
description: Federico Faggin è lo Steve Jobs italiano, un idolo, un eroe, per tutti gli scienziati e appassionati di tecnologia. Nato a Vicenza e poi trasferitosi nella Silicon Valley, con le sue invenzioni, dal microprocessore al touchscreen, ha contribuito a plasmare il presente che tutti conosciamo.
subject: Biography, History, Physics, Microelectronics
author: Federico Faggin

name: Digital Design and Computer Architecture: ARM Edition
description: Digital Design and Computer Architecture: ARM Edition covers the fundamentals of digital logic design and reinforces logic concepts through the design of an ARM microprocessor.
subject: Microelectronics, Digital design
author: Sarah Harris, David Harris

name: Steve Jobs
description: Più di quaranta colloqui personali con Steve Jobs in oltre due anni, e più di cento interviste a familiari, amici, rivali e colleghi, hanno permesso a Walter Isaacson di raccontare l'avvincente storia del geniale imprenditore la cui passione per la perfezione e il cui carisma feroce hanno rivoluzionato sei settori dell'economia e del business: computer, cinema d'animazione, musica, telefonia, tablet, editoria elettronica.
subject: Biography
author: Walter Isaacson

name: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn't clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are lost because of poorly written code. But it doesn't have to be that way.
subject: Programming
author: Robert C. Martin

name: The Hobbit Facsimile First Edition: The Classic Bestselling Fantasy Novel
description: The Hobbit was published on 21 September 1937, with a print run of 1,500 copies. With a beautiful cover design, nearly a dozen black & white illustrations and two black & red maps by the author himself, the book proved to be popular and was reprinted shortly afterwards. History was already being made.
subject: Fantasy
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

name: The Rust Programming Language (Covers Rust 2018)
description: The Rust Programming Language is the official book on Rust: an open source systems programming language that helps you write faster, more reliable software. Rust offers control over low-level details (such as memory usage) in combination with high-level ergonomics, eliminating the hassle traditionally associated with low-level languages.
subject: Programming, Rust
author: Steve Klabnik, Carol Nichols

name: Spring Boot: Up and Running: Building Cloud Native Java and Kotlin Applications
description: Mark Heckler from VMware, the company behind Spring, guides you through Spring Boot's architecture and approach, covering topics such as debugging, testing, and deployment.
subject: Programming, Spring, Java
author: Mark Heckler

name: Web Development With Node and Express: Leveraging the Javascript Stack
description: Build dynamic web applications with Express, a key component of the Node/JavaScript development stack. In this updated edition, author Ethan Brown teaches you Express fundamentals by walking you through the development of an example application.
subject: Programming, Node, Express
author: Ethan Brown

name: Learning React: Modern Patterns for Developing React Apps
description: If you want to learn how to build efficient React applications, this is your book. Ideal for web developers and software engineers who understand how JavaScript, CSS, and HTML work in the browser, this updated edition provides best practices and patterns for writing modern React code.
subject: Programming, JavaScript, React
author: Alex Banks, Eve Porcello

name: Unity Game Development Cookbook: Essentials for Every Game
description: Discover how to use the Unity game engine to its full potential for both 3D and 2D game development; from the basics of scripting to useful tricks in gameplay, behavior, and animation.
subject: Programming, Unity, C#
author: Paris Buttfield-addison, Jon Manning, Tim Nugent

name: Paradiso perduto
description: Poema che si propone la «giustificazione all'uomo delle azioni del Signore», Paradiso perduto usa la forma drammatica per dimostrare che Adamo ed Eva furono puniti perché peccarono, scegliendo deliberatamente il Male. Uniti nella colpa e nell'implacabile sentenza divina, furono cacciati dall'Eden sulla terra: un luogo ignoto nel quale sono destinati a vivere nell'infelicità.
subject: Classic, Poem
author: John Milton
